reviewDetails.comment:
Dr . Immanuel was very thorough and took his time to explain to me why I had dry eyes.
The office staff was very friendly and efficient .
I appreciated that they fit me in as a emergency visit on a Sat .

During this time with concern for Corona Virus they take all necessary precautions to keep patients safe. All rooms were cleaned and prepped before each patient. The waiting room is set up for appropriate distancing. As is typical, everyone there is wonderful. Dr Immanuel is detail oriented and provides a complete exam with follow up explanation and time for questions. I am a Healthcare professsional and know I receive excellent vision care at this practice.

The Dr is very thorough, however the wait is to long. The 1st appt. I was there almost 3 hrs. The 2nd  visit was a follow up scheduled at 8:20. And i was the second patient i was not seen until almost 10 am. Need better time management.
Very professional and kind
he is very through in his exams.

reviewDetails.comment: Dr. Pothiawala has always listened to all of my concerns and addresses each one without rushing me through. She is very knowledgeable as to what is needed to resolve the issues (that can be resolved) with the first medication prescribed.

Great Dermatologist.
Will listen to your concerns and make sure you will have the right treatments.

I have no confidence in Dr Pothiawala. Two very dark spots developed on both knees over the past few months. Dr kept insisting that it was cause by friction. I showed her how impossible that was as both knees have a protruding bone which disables me from performing certain exercises due to pain. But she kept with the friction and giving her assistant a certain look. After I left it was then I realized that she was probably referring to a sexual position... I wish I'd thought of it while in her office as I am a single Christian and 7 years celibate.
Dr. Pothiawala was great at listening to my concerns and helping me find a solution.

I am not convinced as she Diane tell me much about my condition and simply suggested done tropical ointment. I visit her a year back and had similar experience and thought to try her once more but now I regret.

My experience was nothing short of awful. Dr. Pothiawala hardly spent any time with me (my total time there was <20 minutes). I was taken aback and upset about her questioning my skin problems. She filled prescriptions without explaining what they were. She attempted to immediately remove something from my skin as well. She stated "it'll leave a scar" in a threatening manner. There was zero explanation of anything and it was all very very rushed. 

Upon filling the prescriptions at my Pharmacy afterwards (and having to Google them myself to see what they even were)- I found that they were sent over with a misspelling of my last name and under the WRONG insurance. The office staff did not pay attention to detail (important details).

The entire experience at this office from start to finish was terrible.
Very thorough,  kind and detailed with explanation.  Prompt service and smiling faces when you are addressed.

reviewDetails.comment: Dr. Campbell is a caring, kind doctor who always strives to help. He is attentive and responsive. I've been seeing him for years and shall continue to be his patient as long as I have knee problems and he is a practicing doctor.

Dr Campbell quickly identified my rotator cuff tear and prescribed physical therapy and a cortisone injection, both of which have been helpful. He is competent and has a cheerful, welcoming way with patients.

The experience and process was slow and burdensome. Dr, Campbell did little real examination. He and his his team did not respond to e-mail or phone requests EVER.  His eventual treatment of a cortisone injection was supposed to provide significant results  but resulted in no improvement . I have made an appointment with another physician.  A waste of my time and money.
Dr. Campbell helped me with my inflamed rotator cuff.  He was knowledgeable, considerate, did not rush me and favored non-invasive approaches if possible.  Highly recommend him.

Dr Campbell is an excellent surgeon with excellent bedside manners. He took his time to explain the problem and the procedure to me. He has a real and supportive staff which made the preparation for surgery easy and seamless.
Dr. Campbell is a wonderful doctor. Very capable and has a great bedside manner.
Dr. Campbell is extremely patient, and knowledgable, which are much needed to put a patient at ease, psychologically, and physically.

reviewDetails.comment: Dr. Pochapin is an excellent clinician with a wonderful bedside manner.  He is very knowledgeable, and cares about his patients.

Dr. Pochapin is the most incredible doctor I've seen. Beyond his brilliance as a practitioner, he is thoughtful and makes you feel 100% supported as a patient with his commitment to making you feel your best. I would recommend him a million times over!
